```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
V <- 8.5#signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 2) # voltage (V)
R <- 6.8#signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 2) # resistance (ohms)

ans <- signif(V / R, 2)
dis <- c(R / V, V * R)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 5)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{A}$", signif(sc$questions, 2))
```
Question
========
A lamp with a resistance of $`r R` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$ is placed across a potential
difference of $`r V` \,\mathsf{V}$. What is the current through the lamp?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Use Ohm's law:

$$I = \frac{V}{R} = \frac{`r V` \,\mathsf{V}}{`r R` \,\mathsf{\Omega}} = `r ans` \,\mathsf{A}$$
